Example.BHC Span: His H/H remained stable and he was admitted for EGD to evaluate for source of bleeding.
Example.AVS Span: Your blood pressure and heart rate remained stable throughout your stay.

Example.BHC Span: He was treated with BID PPI.
Example.AVS Span: You were treated with a medication called omeprazole to help heal the ulcerated area.

Example.BHC Span: He will need further work-up as an outpatient including PET scan, EUS and swallow study.
Example.AVS Span: We will need to do further tests, including a PET scan, endoscopic ultrasound (EUS), and swallow study.

Example.BHC Span: Patient instructed to avoid NSAIDs in the setting of recent UGIB.
Example.AVS Span: You also reported recent onset back pain, which was treated with Tylenol #3 and later with acetaminophen. The back pain was thought to be musculoskeletal in nature.

Example.BHC Span: Follow up EGD biopsy results, pending at discharge
Example.AVS Span: A biopsy was taken from the mass, and the results are still pending.

Example.BHC Span: After pt was d/c'd final read of CT revealed pulmonary nodules and question of lung infection.
Example.AVS Span: The final read of your CT scan revealed pulmonary nodules, and we recommend a follow-up CT chest in 3 months to assess for any changes.
